Package map

Class MapPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • map.MapPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class MapPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Specialized JPanel that displays a WorldWind map of the world. Specialized versions of MapPanel should be subclasses that use the protected accessor methods, providing encapsulated access to manipulations of those protected entities. Do not expose internal data!

    Important Usage Instructions:
    1. Always instantiate this class, as any GUI-related class, on the GUI event thread.
    2. Call the map panel's start() method before adding the panel to its parent container. Failure to do so may result in a blank map.
    3. After the map panel is installed into its parent container, the parent container should have its validate() and repaint() methods called to help the map panel size correctly.
    4. A JScrollPane is recommended as a parent container as it will allow more freedom in component sizing.
    5. A layer can be enabled or disabled at run time simply by calling its setEnabled(boolean isEnabled) method.
    6. The start() method will print out all the installed layers at that time, including their names, enabled status, and layer class name.
    7. Many of the default NASA layers are instances of the same layer class, e.g. WMSTiledImageLayer, so the methods that insert layers using the layer class type may not work to find certain layers. Instead, use the getLayerByName(String layerName) and insertAtLayer(Layer layer, String targetLayerName, boolean insertBefore) methods.


    Modified 12/07/2018 by Stephen Wong: Removed layer initialization via the Configuration values because the Bing Imagery high resolution satellite maps would not display on some machines. Changed over to allowing all the default NASA layers to load and then explicitly enabling or disabling them using the LayerNameEnabledMap.
    Author:
    Scott Rixner, Stephen Wong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • LayerNameEnabledMap

        public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> LayerNameEnabledMap
        Maps the names of the default WWJ layers from NASA to their default enabled state. When instantiated, the MapPanel will print out all of its layers, enabled or not. The layers are listed below in their display order, from the bottom-most layer to the top-most layer.
        As the available layers are periodically updated by NASA, be sure to tell the course staff if you see default layers that are not on this list. By default, MapPanel will enable any unknown layers that it encounters during its instantiation.
        To change the enabled values of any of the layers, make a copy of this Map, e.g. (note that the code in the Javadocs is written to be HTML compatible)
        Map<String, Boolean> myLayerNameEnabledMap = new HashMap<String, Boolean>(MapPanel.LayerNameEnabledMap);
        then modify the desired entries in your copy. Do not attempt to modify or mutate this field. Use MapPanel constructor that explicitly takes the layerNameEnabledMap for custom enabling of layers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapPanel

        public MapPanel()
        Construct a MapPanel with a flat Earth view and the default LayerNameEnabledMap values. Equivalent to MapPanel(EarthFlat.class)

      • MapPanel

        public MapPanel​(java.lang.Class<? extends gov.nasa.worldwind.globes.Globe> globeTypeClass)
        Construct a new MapPanel using the given type of Globe view and the default LayerNameEnabledMap values. Possible values for globeTypeClass: Earth.class, EarthFlat.class, EllipsoidalGlobe.class, FlatGlobe.class
        Parameters:
        globeTypeClass - The Class file for a class/interface extending/implementing Globe which determines the type of view of the Earth.

      • MapPanel

        public MapPanel​(java.lang.Class<? extends gov.nasa.worldwind.globes.Globe> globeTypeClass,
                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> layerNameEnabledMap)
        Construct a new MapPanel using the given type of Globe view and a custom layerNameEnabledMap. See the other constructors for possible globeTypeClass values. See the LayerNameEnabledMap field docs for description and usage instructions.
        Parameters:
        globeTypeClass - The Class file for a class/interface extending/implementing Globe which determines the type of view of the Earth.
        layerNameEnabledMap - A mapping of layer names to their default enabled state. Any layers not specified will be automatically enabled.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the MapPanel by creating the WWJ Map and showing it.

      • addRightClickAction

        public void addRightClickAction​(IRightClickAction rightClick)
        Add an action to be performed upon a right click on the map. Attempting to add the same action object more than once will have no effect. A previously removed action can be re-added. The Point object that is given to the IRightClickAction has been modified so that its getAltitude() method returns the eye point altitude at the time of the right click. getElevation() still returns the vertical position of the ground at that location.
        Parameters:
        rightClick - - desired action

      • removeRightClickAction

        public void removeRightClickAction​(IRightClickAction rightClickAction)
        Remove an action that is being performed upon a right click on the map. No-op if the given IRightClickAction was not previously added. The action object can be re-added later if desired.
        Parameters:
        rightClickAction - - a IRightClickAction that was previously added by addRightClickAction

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position pos,
                        boolean fly)
        Set the position of the map to the indicated position. If "fly" is true, the map will animate from the current position to the indicated position, otherwise it will jump there immediately.
        Parameters:
        pos - - desired destination position
        fly - - fly if true, jump if false

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer​(gov.nasa.worldwind.layers.Layer layer)
        Add a layer of annotations to the map. Layer is added below the compass layer.
        Parameters:
        layer - layer to add to the map

      • removeLayer

        public void removeLayer​(gov.nasa.worldwind.layers.Layer layer)
        Remove a layer from the map
        Parameters:
        layer - layer to remove from the map

      • getLayerByName

        public gov.nasa.worldwind.layers.Layer getLayerByName​(java.lang.String layerName)
        Retrieves an installed layer given its name. Use this method when there are multiple layers installed that are instances of the same layer class type.
        Use this method in conjunction with insertAtLayer(Layer layer, Layer targetLayer, boolean insertBefore) to insert a layer at a specific position when there are multiple layers that are instances of the same layer class.
        Parameters:
        layerName - -- name
        Returns:
        The first layer encountered with the given name or null if nothing was found.

      • insertAtLayer

        public void insertAtLayer​(gov.nasa.worldwind.layers.Layer layer,
                          java.lang.Class<?> layerType,
                          boolean insertBefore)
        Insert the given Layer before or after the first occurrence of the given layer type. DO NOT USE THIS METHOD IF THERE ARE MORE THAN ONE INSTANCE OF THE GIVEN LAYER CLASS TYPE! Instead, use getLayerByName(String layerName) in conjunction with insertAtLayer(Layer layer, Layer targetLayer, boolean insertBefore)
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer to insert
        layerType - The type of layer to insert before or after
        insertBefore - boolean that if true, will all insertion before the given type and if false, will insert after the type has been encountered.

      • insertAtLayer

        public void insertAtLayer​(gov.nasa.worldwind.layers.Layer layer,
                          java.lang.String targetLayerName,
                          boolean insertBefore)
        Convenience method that combines getLayerByName(targetLayerName) and insertAtLayer(layer, targetLayer, insertBefore) to enable the insertion of a layer based on the name of the target layer. This method is useful when there are multiple installed layers that are instances of the same layer type.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer to insert
        targetLayerName - The name of the desired target layer
        insertBefore - boolean that if true, will all insertion before the given type and if false, will insert after the type has been encountered.

      • insertAtLayer

        public void insertAtLayer​(gov.nasa.worldwind.layers.Layer layer,
                          gov.nasa.worldwind.layers.Layer targetLayer,
                          boolean insertBefore)
        Insert the given layer before or after the first occurrence of the given layer object
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer to insert
        targetLayer - The layer before or after which the given layer will be inserted
        insertBefore - Boolean that if true, will all insertion before the given type and if false, will insert after the type has been encountered.
